# l06


## 1

```markdown
Example

Hapke's

\[
\frac{\cos \Theta_i}{\cos \Theta_e}
\]

R(p, q)?

\[
\cos \Theta_i = \hat{n} \cdot \hat{s}
\]

\[
\cos \Theta_e = \hat{n} \cdot \hat{v}
\]

\[
\hat{v} = \hat{z}
\]

\[
\hat{n} = \frac{(-p, -q, 1)^T}{\sqrt{1 + p^2 + q^2}}
\]

Thus \(\hat{n} \cdot \hat{v} = \frac{1}{\sqrt{1 + p^2 + q^2}}\)

\[
R(p, q) = \frac{1 + p \rho + q \eta}{\sqrt{1 + \rho^2 + \eta^2}}
\]

\[
R = cI_e \Rightarrow R^2 I_s = I_r + \beta p + q \cdot q
\]

Get the shape of the surface?

We only have the surface reflectance map.
2 unknowns, 1 measurement (p, q)

\[
\begin{bmatrix}
s_1^T \\
s_2^T \\
s_3^T
\end{bmatrix}
= S
\quad
M =
\begin{bmatrix}
E_1 \\
E_2 \\
E_3
\end{bmatrix}
= E
\]

\[
\mu = S^{-1}E
\]

\[
\hat{\mu} = \frac{\mu}{\rho} \quad (\rho = ||\mu||)
\]

\[
\det(S) = s_1 \cdot (s_2 \land s_3) = [s_1 \ s_2 \ s_3]
\]

\[
[s_1 \ s_2 \ s_3] = 0 \iff (s_1, s_2, s_3) \text{ on the same plane}
\]

\[
V = \det S \text{ is maximum when } s_1 \perp s_2 \perp s_3
\]

On the other hand, we want to minimize the self-shadow
\[
\rightarrow \text{ tradeoff}
\]
